com.sri.ai.expresso.helper

Class Expressions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.expresso.helper.Expressions

  • @Beta
public class Expressions
extends Object
    A class of helper methods for Expressions.

    braz

      static LinkedHashMap<Expression,Expression> getRelationalMap(Collection<Expression> expressions, Expression functor, com.google.common.base.Function<Expression,Expression> defaultValueGivenKey)
      Given a collection of expressions c, returns a map with the an entry for each expression e in c, defined as follows: (key, value), if e is a binary application of functor on (key, value), and (e, defaultValueGivenKey.evaluate(e)) otherwise.

      Return a function application identical to the one received but for the i-th argument being removed.
      static Expression replaceArguments(Expression expression, List<Expression> newArguments)
      Returns a copy of an expressions with its arguments replaced by new arguments, with same expression returned if the new arguments turn out to be the same objects as the current arguments.
      static Expression replaceImmediateSubexpressions(Expression expression, com.google.common.base.Function<Expression,Expression> replacementFunction)
      Replaces immediate subexpressions by versions provided by a replacement function, conserving original instance if function returns original subexpressions.
      static Expression round(Expression expression, int precision)
      Takes an expression and, if it is numeric symbol, replaces it by a rounded value according to a precision (a number of significant digits to be kept); otherwise, return the expression itself.
      static Expression roundToAGivenPrecision(Expression expression, int precision, Registry registry)
      Replaces all numeric symbols in expressions by a rounded value according to a precision (a number of significant digits to be kept).
      static com.sri.ai.util.base.PairOf<Expression> standardizeApart(Symbol symbol, com.google.common.base.Predicate<Expression> alreadyDefined, Expression containingSymbol)
      Given a symbol, a predicate indicating what symbols are already defined in some situation, and an expression possibly containing the symbol, prime the symbol until it is unique, and return the new symbol and the result of replacing the old symbol by the new in the expression containing it.
      static List<Expression> takeFormulaAsConjunctionAndReturnConjuncts(Expression expression)
      Takes a formula and, if it is a conjunction, returns the list of conjuncts and, if it is not, returns the formula itself (thus considering it a 1-conjunct conjunction).

      • makeFromSyntaxTree

        @Deprecated
public static Expression makeFromSyntaxTree(SyntaxTree syntaxTree)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns an expression represented by a given syntax tree. Scheduled to be removed once expressions are no longer based on syntax trees.

      • makeUniqueVariable

        public static Expression makeUniqueVariable(String variableName,
                                            Expression expression,
                                            Registry registry)
        Given a proposed name for a variable ensure that a valid unique variable is returned.
        Parameters:
        variableName - a proposed name for the variable.
        expression - an expression to check for other variables in order to ensure uniqueness.
        registry - the context that the variable is being created in.
        Returns:
        a uniquely named variable in the context of the passed in expression.

      • getRelationalMap

        public static LinkedHashMap<Expression,Expression> getRelationalMap(Collection<Expression> expressions,
                                                                    Expression functor,
                                                                    com.google.common.base.Function<Expression,Expression> defaultValueGivenKey)
        Given a collection of expressions c, returns a map with the an entry for each expression e in c, defined as follows: (key, value), if e is a binary application of functor on (key, value), and (e, defaultValueGivenKey.evaluate(e)) otherwise. This was originally motivated by the problem of mapping collections such as X in Integer, Y, Z in Real to something like X -> Integer, Y -> type(Y), Z -> Real.

      • getVariableReferences

        public static LinkedHashSet<Expression> getVariableReferences(Expression expression,
                                                              com.google.common.base.Predicate<Expression> isUniquelyNamedConstantPredicate)
        A static method returning the variable references in a given expression, for a certain predicate indicating uniquely named constants. By reference, we mean points in which a variable is used, not declared. For example, this method returns {x} given {{(on y) x + 1}}, and {x,y} given {{(on y) x + y + 1}}.

      • getVariableReferences

        public static LinkedHashSet<Expression> getVariableReferences(Expression expression,
                                                              Registry registry)
        A static method returning the variable references in a given expression, in a certain context. By reference, we mean points in which a variable is used, not declared. For example, this method returns {x} given {{(on y) x + 1}}, and {x,y} given {{(on y) x + y + 1}}.

      • applyJavaFunctionToArgumentsAndReAssembleFunctionApplication

        public static Expression applyJavaFunctionToArgumentsAndReAssembleFunctionApplication(com.google.common.base.Function<Expression,Expression> function,
                                                                                      Expression expression)
        Given a function F and a function application f(a1, ..., an), returns f(F(a1), ..., F(an)).

      • addExpressionToArgumentsOfFunctionApplicationOrCreateIt

        public static Expression addExpressionToArgumentsOfFunctionApplicationOrCreateIt(Expression expression,
                                                                                 String functor,
                                                                                 Expression newArgument)
        If expression is a function application of given functor, return a new one with same arguments and new argument given. If it is not a function application, create a function application with given functor, the given expression and the new argument. This is useful for keeping, for example, a disjuction (X = b or X = c, or, X = a) -> X = b or X = c or X = a (X = b and X = c, or, X = a) -> (X = b and X = c) or X = a (true, or, X = a) -> true or X = a

      • replaceImmediateSubexpressions

        public static Expression replaceImmediateSubexpressions(Expression expression,
                                                        com.google.common.base.Function<Expression,Expression> replacementFunction)
        Replaces immediate subexpressions by versions provided by a replacement function, conserving original instance if function returns original subexpressions.

      • zipApply

        public static List<Expression> zipApply(String functor,
                                        List<Iterator<?>> argumentIterators)
        Returns a list of applications of a functor to successive lists of arguments, formed from the next elements of a list of iterators. For example, zipApply("+", list(list(1, 2, 3).iterator(), list(4, 5, 6).iterator())) is list(parse("1 + 4"), parse("2 + 5"), parse("3 + 6")).
        Parameters:
        functor -
        argumentIterators -
        Returns:
        a list of applications of a functor to successive lists of arguments, formed from the next elements of a list of iterators.

      • standardizeApart

        public static com.sri.ai.util.base.PairOf<Expression> standardizeApart(Symbol symbol,
                                                                       com.google.common.base.Predicate<Expression> alreadyDefined,
                                                                       Expression containingSymbol)
        Given a symbol, a predicate indicating what symbols are already defined in some situation, and an expression possibly containing the symbol, prime the symbol until it is unique, and return the new symbol and the result of replacing the old symbol by the new in the expression containing it.
        Parameters:
        symbol -
        alreadyDefined -
        containingSymbol -
        Returns:
        the new symbol and the result of replacing the old symbol by the new in the expression containing it.
